titleStmt.title: Men, Women, or Children. Ruptures or broken bellies cured by a traveller famous in Germany, and other countries; no cure [n]o money, but for trusses you may have them made easie, none such made in England, as these to be found by experience, with hinges, springs, joynts, screws, or plain, so easie and fit to go about your business without any pain or trouble; ...
titleStmt.author: [Collings, Richard]

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
At end: "By Rich Collins, from nine to twelve, ..."
Imperfect: stained, torn and a few letters faded.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
